A PUT request is used to convey the configuration parameters for the A PUT request is used to convey the configuration parameters for the
signaling channel (e.g., heartbeat timeout, maximum retransmissions signaling channel (e.g., heartbeat timeout, maximum retransmissions
etc). Message transmission parameters for CoAP are defined in etc). Message transmission parameters for CoAP are defined in
Section 4.8 of [RFC7252]. The recommended values of transmission Section 4.8 of [RFC7252]. The recommended values of transmission
parameter values are ack_timeout (2 seconds), max-retransmit (7), parameter values are ack_timeout (2 seconds), max-retransmit (7),
ack-random-factor (1.5) and heartbeat-timeout (371 seconds). The ack-random-factor (1.5) and heartbeat-timeout (371 seconds). The
heartbeat-timeout value is equal to the MAX_TRANSMIT_WAIT heartbeat-timeout value is equal to the MAX_TRANSMIT_WAIT counter
(Section 4.8.2 in [RFC7252]), whose value is derived from (Section 4.8.2 in [RFC7252]) whose value is derived from transmission
transmission parameters. If the DOTS agent wishes to change the parameters. If the DOTS agent wishes to change the default values of
default values of message transmission parameters then it should message transmission parameters then it should follow the guidance
follow the guidance given in Section 4.8.1 of [RFC7252]. The DOTS given in Section 4.8.1 of [RFC7252]. The DOTS agents MUST use the
agents MUST use the negotiated values for message transmission negotiated values for message transmission parameters and default
parameters and default values for non-negotiated message transmission values for non-negotiated message transmission parameters. The
parameters. The signaling channel session configuration is signaling channel session configuration is applicable to a single
applicable to a single DOTS signal channel session between the DOTS DOTS signal channel session between the DOTS agents.
